members.name: _manifest
members.doc: The array of all component manifests. These objects have the following set of properties recognized by the slicer:
members.short_doc: The array of all component manifests. ...

members.name: _shortcuts
members.doc: The collection of shortcuts for a given alias (e.g., 'widget.panel'). This is an object keyed by alias whose values are arrays of shortcut definitions.
members.short_doc: The collection of shortcuts for a given alias (e.g., 'widget.panel'). ...

members.name: addManifest
members.doc:
Adds one ore more component entries to the theme manifest. These entries will be instantiated by the Ext.theme.render method when the page is ready.

Usage:

 Ext.theme.addManifest({
         xtype: 'widget.menu',
         folder: 'menu',
         delegate: '.x-menu-item-link',
         filename: 'menu-item-active',
         config: {
             floating: false,
             width: 200,
             items: [{
                 text: 'test',
                 cls: 'x-menu-item-active'
             }]
         }
     },{
         //...
     });

params.name: manifest
params.doc: {Object} An object with type of component, slicing information and component configuration. If this parameter is an array, each element is treated as a manifest entry. Otherwise, each argument passed is treated as a manifest entry.

properties.name: xtype
properties.doc: {String} The xtype ('grid') or alias ('widget.grid'). This is used to specify the type of component to create as well as a potential key to any shortcuts defined for the xtype.

properties.name: config
properties.doc: {Object} The component configuration object. The properties of this depend on the xtype of the component.

properties.name: delegate
properties.doc: {String} The DOM query to use to select the element to slice. The default is to slice the primary element of the component.

properties.name: parentCls
properties.doc: An optional CSS class to add to the parent of the component.

properties.name: setup
properties.doc: {Function} An optional function to be called to initialize the component.

properties.name: component
properties.doc: {Ext.Component} The component instance

properties.name: folder
properties.doc: {String} The folder in to which to produce image slices. Only applies to Ext JS 4.1 (removed in 4.2).

properties.name: filename
properties.doc: {String} The base filename for slices. Only applies to Ext JS 4.1 (removed in 4.2).

properties.name: reverse
properties.doc: {Boolean} True to position the slices for linear gradient background at then opposite "end" (right or bottom) and apply the stretch to the area before it (left or top). Only applies to Ext JS 4.1 (removed in 4.2).

members.short_doc: Adds one ore more component entries to the theme manifest. ...

members.name: addPrefix
members.doc: This method ensures that a given string has the specified prefix (e.g., "widget.").
members.short_doc: This method ensures that a given string has the specified prefix (e.g., "widget."). ...

members.name: addShortcuts
members.doc:
Adds one or more shortcuts to the rendering process. A shortcut is an object that looks the same as a manifest entry. These are combined by copying the properties from the shortcut over those of the manifest entry. In basic terms:

 var config = Ext.apply(Ext.apply({}, manfiest.config), shortcut.config);
 var entry = Ext.apply(Ext.apply({}, manfiest), shortcut);
 entry.config = config;

This is not exactly the process, but the idea is the same. The difference is that the ui of the manifest entry is used to replace any "{ui}" substrings found in any string properties of the shortcut or its config object.

Usage:

 Ext.theme.addShortcuts({
     'widget.foo': [{
             config: {
             }
         },{
             config: {
             }
         }],

     'widget.bar': [ ... ]
 });
members.short_doc: Adds one or more shortcuts to the rendering process. ...

members.name: addWidget
members.doc: This method returns the given string with "widget." added to the front if that is not already present.
members.short_doc:
This method returns the given string with "widget." added to the front if that is
not already present. ...

members.name: applyShortcut
members.doc: This method accepts an manifest entry and a shortcut entry and returns the merged version.
members.short_doc:
This method accepts an manifest entry and a shortcut entry and returns the merged
version. ...

members.name: copyProps
members.doc:
This method copies property from a src object to a dest object and reaplces "{foo}" fragments of any string properties as defined in the tpl object.

 var obj = Ext.theme.copyProps({}, {
                 foo: 'Hello-{ui}'
             }, {
                 ui: 'World'
             });

 console.log('obj.foo: ' + obj.foo); // logs "Hello-World"

return.name: return
return.doc: The dest object or a new object (if dest was null).

members.short_doc:
This method copies property from a src object to a dest object and reaplces
"{foo}" fragments of any string propertie...

members.name: intersect_arguments
members.doc: Inspects the arguments in current scope, filters them down to only the ones supported by a pair of mixins, and returns the result as a fashion map.
members.short_doc:
Inspects the arguments in current scope, filters them down to only the ones
supported by a pair of mixins, and return...

members.name: isOnline
members.doc: Indicates if the page is currently running in online or offline mode, according to the navigator.onLine property.

return.name: return
return.doc: true if the page is currently running in an online mode.

members.short_doc:
Indicates if the page is currently running in online or offline mode, according
to the navigator.onLine property. ...

members.name: render
members.doc: Renders all of the components that have been added to the manifest.
members.short_doc: Renders all of the components that have been added to the manifest. ...

members.name: renderWidget
members.doc: Renders a component given its manifest and shortcut entries.
members.short_doc: Renders a component given its manifest and shortcut entries. ...

members.name: run
members.doc: Renders all components (see render) and notifies the Slicer that things are ready.
members.short_doc: Renders all components (see render) and notifies the Slicer that things are ready. ...

members.name: setData
members.doc: Sets the data-slicer attribute to the JSON-encoded value of the provided data.
members.short_doc: Sets the data-slicer attribute to the JSON-encoded value of the provided data. ...
